stk.calculators.ga.plotters module¶

Defines plotters.

Plotters are calculators which produce graphs. They generally do this by decorating other calculators to hook into them, collect data from them and then plot the results. To see examples of how to use plotters look at the documentation of the individual plotters. For example SelectionPlotter and ProgressPlotter.

Available plotters.¶

  1. ProgressPlotter
  2. SelectionPlotter

Extending stk: Making new plotters.¶

New plotters should inherit Plotter and define a plot() method. Note that plotters do no necessarily have to make a plot when plot() is made. For example, SelectionPlotter plots every time the Selector it is used with becomes exhausted and it’s plot() does nothing..

class stk.calculators.ga.plotters.Plotter¶

Bases: object

A base class for plotters.

__init__¶

Initialize self. See help(type(self)) for accurate signature.

plot(progress)¶

Plots a graph.

Parameters:progress (Population) – A Population where each generation of the GA is a subpopulation.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
class stk.calculators.ga.plotters.ProgressPlotter(filename, attr, y_label, default)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.ga.plotters.Plotter

Plots how an attribute changes during a GA.

The produced plot will show the GA generations on the x axis and the min, mean and max values of an attribute on the y axis.

filename¶

The basename of the files. This means it should exclude file extensions.

Type:str
attr¶

The name of the attribute which is plotted. It must be an attribute on the Molecule objects made by the GA.

Type:str
y_label¶

The y label for the produced graph.

Type:str
default¶

When a molecule in the population does not have attribute attr, this is the default value to use for it.

Type:float

Examples

Plot how fitness value changes with GA generations.

# progress has subpopulations where each subpopulation is a
# generation of a GA.
progress = Population(...)

# Make the plotter which plots the fitness change across
# generations.
plotter = ProgressPlotter(filename='fitness_plot',
                          attr='fitness',
                          y_label='Fitness',
                          default=1e-4)
plotter.plot(progress)

Plot how the number of atoms changes with GA generations.

# progress has subpopulations where each subpopulation is a
# generation of a GA.
progress = Population(...)

# Make the plotter which plots the number of atoms across
# generations. Note that the GA must create the num_atoms
# attribute on the molecules. This can be done in the fitness
# function, for example.
plotter = ProgressPlotter(filename='atom_plot',
                          attr='num_atoms',
                          y_label='Number of Atoms',
                          default=0)
plotter.plot(progress)
__init__(filename, attr, y_label, default)¶

Initializes a ProgressPlotter instance.

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – The basename of the files. This means it should not include file extensions.
  • attr (str) – The name of the attribute which is plotted. It must be an attribute on the Molecule objects made by the GA.
  • y_label (str) – The y label for the produced graph.
  • default (float) – When a molecule in the population does not have attribute attr, this is the default value to use for it.
plot(progress)¶

Plots a progress plot.

Parameters:progress (Population) – A Population where each generation of the GA is a subpopulation.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
class stk.calculators.ga.plotters.SelectionPlotter(filename, selector)¶

Bases: stk.calculators.ga.plotters.Plotter

Plots which molecules a Selector selects.

filename¶

The basename of the files. This means it should not include file extensions.

Type:str
selector¶

The Selector whose selection of molecules is plotted.

Type:Selector

Examples

# Make a population of molecules.
pop = Population(...)

# Make a selector.
roulette = Roulette(num=10)

# Make a plotter.
SelectionPlotter('roulette_counter', roulette)

# Select the molecules.
selected = list(roulette.select(pop))

# There should now be a file called "roulette_counter_1.png"
# which shows a graph of all the selected molecules.

# Make another population.
pop2 = Population(...)

# Select molecules from this other population.
selected2 = list(roulette.select(pop2))

# There should now be a file called "roulette_counter_2.png"
# which shows a graph of all the selected molecules.

# Select from the original population again.
selected3 = list(roulette.select(pop))

# There should now be a file called "roulette_counter_3.png"
# which shows a graph of all the selected molecules.

# And so on every time you use "roulette.select()".
__init__(filename, selector)¶

Initializes a SelectionPlotter instance.

Parameters:
  • filename (str) – The basename of the files. This means it should not include file extensions.
  • selector (Selector) – The Selector whose selection of molecules is plotted.
_plot(counter)¶

Plots a selection counter.

Parameters:counter (Counter) – A counter specifying which molecules were selected and how many times.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
plot(progress)¶

Does nothing.

This Plotter creates a plot each time selector is finished selecting molecules.

Parameters:progress (Population) – A Population where each generation of the GA is a subpopulation.
Returns:None
Return type:NoneType
update_counter(select)¶

Decorates Selector.select().

This is a decorator which makes sure that every time Selector.select() selects a Molecule a counter keeping track of selected molecules is updated.

Parameters:select (function) – The Selector.select() method to decorate.
Returns:The decorated Selector.select() method.
Return type:function
